= Components =
(generated)


*Component items*:
  * *trunk-rectus-abdominis-muscle*: flexion of trunk/lumbar vertebrae; keeping the internal organs intact and in creating intra-abdominal pressure, such as when exercising or lifting heavy weights
  * *Trunk - external intercostal muscles* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-external-intercostal-muscles): aid in quiet and forced inhalation
  * *Trunk - serratus posterior superior muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-serratus-posterior-superior-muscle): elevate the ribs which aids in inspiration
  * *Trunk - semispinalis dorsi (thoracis)* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-semispinalis-dorsi-thoracis): extends vertebral column
  * *Trunk - transversus thoracis muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-transversus-thoracis-muscle): depresses the ribs; aids in exertional expiration by decreasing the transverse diameter of the thoracic cage
  * *Trunk - subcostalis muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-subcostalis-muscle): synergist in aiding the internal intercostal muscles with forced exhalation
  * *Trunk - transversus abdominis muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-transversus-abdominis): compress the ribs and viscera, providing thoracic and pelvic stability
  * *Trunk - internal intercostal muscles* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-internal-intercostal-muscles): aid in forced expiration
  * *Trunk - serratus posterior inferior muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-serratus-posterior-inferior-muscle): depress the lower ribs, aiding in expiration
  * *Trunk - abdominal internal oblique muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-internal-oblique-muscle): compresses abdomen and rotates vertebral column
  * *Trunk - pyramidalis muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-pyramidalis-muscle): tensing the linea alba
  * *Trunk - abdominal somatic receptors* (trunk-abdominal-somatic-receptors -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG AVA.PN.SG.DRG]): somatic sensation from skin of lower abdomen and lateral side of gluteal region
  * *Trunk - adrenal gland* ([BrainRegionAVA_PN_SYM_SMG AVA.PN.SYM.SMG] -> adrenal-gland): releasing hormones in response to stress
  * *Trunk - abdominal external oblique muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-abdominal-external-oblique-muscle): rotates torso
  * *Trunk - iliocostalis muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-iliocostalis-muscle): extends and lateral flexes spine
  * *Trunk - interspinales muscles* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-interspinales-muscles): aid in extension and rotation of vertebral column
  * *Trunk - intertransversarii muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-intertransversarii-muscle): aid in lateral flexion of vertebral column; acting bilaterally, stabilize vertebral column
  * *Trunk - levatores costarum muscles* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-levatores-costarum-muscles): elevate ribs, assisting respiration; assist with lateral flexion of vertebral column}
  * *Trunk - longissimus muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-longissimus-muscle): extends spine
  * *Trunk - multifidus muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM BMA.SC.VH.VM] -> trunk-multifidus-muscle): stabilizes vertebrae in local movements of vertebral column
  * *Trunk - quadratus lumborum muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-quadratus-lumborum-muscle): extension of lumbar vertebral column, with bilateral contraction; alone, lateral flexion of vertebral column; together, depression of thoracic rib cage
  * *Trunk - rotatores muscles* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-rotatores-muscles): facilitates the unilateral rotation and bilateral extension of the spine
  * *Trunk - semispinalis cervicis* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-semispinalis-cervicis-muscle): extends and rotates the head to the contralateral side and also extends the ribs
  * *Trunk - spinalis muscle* ([BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM BMA.SC.VH.PM] -> trunk-spinalis-muscle): lateral flexion of spine
